repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Allows setting the current window of a non-current tabpage without switching tabpages / matches `nvim_tabpage_get_win`.

Extracted from #24507, because it's a relatively small change but the rest of that PR is blocked / not ready.

comment_data.body: I'd mention explicitly somehow that `{win}` already needs to be in the tabpage (it is obvious to anyone already familiar with the "model", but it is good if the docs are friendly even to someone just getting used to it).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3336,6 +3336,16 @@ nvim_tabpage_set_var({tabpage}, {name}, {value})
       • {name}     Variable name
       • {value}    Variable value
 
+nvim_tabpage_set_win({tabpage}, {win})                *nvim_tabpage_set_win()*
+    Sets the current window in a tabpage

comment_data.body: Ahh yes that's a good point, thanks!
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3336,6 +3336,16 @@ nvim_tabpage_set_var({tabpage}, {name}, {value})
       • {name}     Variable name
       • {value}    Variable value
 
+nvim_tabpage_set_win({tabpage}, {win})                *nvim_tabpage_set_win()*
+    Sets the current window in a tabpage

comment_data.body:
Do I need this null check? It looks like `get_win` assumes that there will always be a tabpage for a window.

Edit: assuming this is the case but let me know if I'm wrong :)
is there a test for the failure mode? e.g. a window-id that doesn't belong to the tabpage.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3336,6 +3336,13 @@ nvim_tabpage_set_var({tabpage}, {name}, {value})
       • {name}     Variable name
       • {value}    Variable value
 
+nvim_tabpage_set_win({tabpage}, {win})                *nvim_tabpage_set_win()*
+    Sets the current window in a tabpage
+
+    Parameters: ~
+      • {tabpage}  Tabpage handle, or 0 for current tabpage
+      • {win}      Window handle, must already belong to {tabpage}

comment_data.body:
I'll add that now :)

Edit: added
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3336,6 +3336,13 @@ nvim_tabpage_set_var({tabpage}, {name}, {value})
       • {name}     Variable name
       • {value}    Variable value
 
+nvim_tabpage_set_win({tabpage}, {win})                *nvim_tabpage_set_win()*
+    Sets the current window in a tabpage
+
+    Parameters: ~
+      • {tabpage}  Tabpage handle, or 0 for current tabpage
+      • {win}      Window handle, must already belong to {tabpage}

comment_data.body: Might want to set `tp_prevwin` to the old `tp_curwin` here too, but only if `tp->tp_curwin != wp` (to avoid `tp_prevwin == tp_curwin`).
As `wp_tp == tp == curtab`, `win_enter(wp, true)` could work?
Ah this is a very good point, thanks!
Thanks for the reviews! Will add this in now.
The doc comment says that autocmds may close the window immediately so the caller must check `win_valid(wp)` - does this mean I should ensure the window is valid before calling, or after?

Not necessary here, as `wp != curwin` would handle that (`goto_tabpage_win()` would also be affected).

I guess the theoretical concern is the autocmd closing `wp` and opening a new window that happens to be allocated in the same storage as `wp`, but IIRC that's not possible from autocmds as they're not freed immediately (maybe except if two different autocmds are applied after each other, and the caller doesn't check `win_valid()` between the calls).
Gotcha, that makes sense. Thanks!
Moving this into the condition may make the code clearer.
Good idea, thanks!

```suggestion
      command('tabnew')
      command('vsplit')
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,56 @@ describe('api/tabpage', function()
     end)
   end)
 
+  describe('set_win', function()
+    it('works', function()
+      helpers.command('tabnew')
+      helpers.command('vsplit')

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    it('works in non-current tabpages', function()
      command('tabnew')
      command('vsplit')
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,56 @@ describe('api/tabpage', function()
     end)
   end)
 
+  describe('set_win', function()
+    it('works', function()
+      helpers.command('tabnew')
+      helpers.command('vsplit')
+      local tab1, tab2 = unpack(api.nvim_list_tabpages())
+      local win1, win2, win3 = unpack(api.nvim_list_wins())
+      eq({ win1 }, api.nvim_tabpage_list_wins(tab1))
+      eq({ win2, win3 }, api.nvim_tabpage_list_wins(tab2))
+      eq(win2, api.nvim_tabpage_get_win(tab2))
+      api.nvim_tabpage_set_win(tab2, win3)
+      eq(win3, api.nvim_tabpage_get_win(tab2))
+    end)
+
+    it('works in non-current tabgpages', function()
+      helpers.command('tabnew')
+      helpers.command('vsplit')

comment_data.body: `tab2` is already the current tabpage, so it's not necessary to set it, and the `eq()` can be moved just after the `nvim_tabpage_list_wins` calls.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -32,6 +32,63 @@ describe('api/tabpage', function()
     end)
   end)
 
+  describe('set_win', function()
+    it('works', function()
+      command('tabnew')
+      command('vsplit')
+      local tab1, tab2 = unpack(api.nvim_list_tabpages())
+      local win1, win2, win3 = unpack(api.nvim_list_wins())
+      eq({ win1 }, api.nvim_tabpage_list_wins(tab1))
+      eq({ win2, win3 }, api.nvim_tabpage_list_wins(tab2))
+      eq(win2, api.nvim_tabpage_get_win(tab2))
+      api.nvim_tabpage_set_win(tab2, win3)
+      eq(win3, api.nvim_tabpage_get_win(tab2))
+    end)
+
+    it('works in non-current tabpages', function()
+      command('tabnew')
+      command('vsplit')
+      local tab1, tab2 = unpack(api.nvim_list_tabpages())
+      local win1, win2, win3 = unpack(api.nvim_list_wins())
+      eq({ win1 }, api.nvim_tabpage_list_wins(tab1))
+      eq({ win2, win3 }, api.nvim_tabpage_list_wins(tab2))
+      eq(win2, api.nvim_tabpage_get_win(tab2))
+      eq(win2, api.nvim_get_current_win())
+
+      command('tabprev')
+
+      eq(tab1, api.nvim_get_current_tabpage())
+
+      eq(win2, api.nvim_tabpage_get_win(tab2))
+      api.nvim_tabpage_set_win(tab2, win3)
+      eq(win3, api.nvim_tabpage_get_win(tab2))
+
+      command('tabnext')
+      eq(win3, api.nvim_get_current_win())
+    end)
+
+    it('throws an error when the window does not belong to the tabpage', function()
+      command('tabnew')
+      command('vsplit')
+      local tab1, tab2 = unpack(api.nvim_list_tabpages())
+      local win1, win2, win3 = unpack(api.nvim_list_wins())
+      eq({ win1 }, api.nvim_tabpage_list_wins(tab1))
+      eq({ win2, win3 }, api.nvim_tabpage_list_wins(tab2))
+
+      eq(
+        string.format('Window does not belong to tabpage %d', tab2),
+        pcall_err(api.nvim_tabpage_set_win, tab2, win1)
+      )
+
+      api.nvim_set_current_tabpage(tab2)
+      eq(win2, api.nvim_get_current_win())

comment_regular_data.body: Doc tags should be fixed, hopefully CI passes now
Seems like CI failure is just a flaky test and not this PR? Not sure though.
Awesome, thanks for the reviews and guidance on this everyone!

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(api): add `nvim_tabpage_set_win`
